title: URL handlers
author: benwa
body_snippet:
A few monitoring tools (LibreNMS, Spiceworks, and TotalView to name a couple) add quick links for SSH, Telnet, RDP, VNC, etc.  It would be cool to associate something like `ssh://` to open up an mRemoteNG tab to the shell.
Maybe even be smart enough to see if it's already saved in the list and use whatever settings are saved.

iterations.description: URL handler/protocol association is an OS-level feature requiring deep shell integration and was already proposed for a major 2.0 redesign, making it out of scope for current incremental releases

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet:
When we implement this, we should support handling the following URI schemes as defined by IANA (https://www.iana.org/assignments/uri-schemes/uri-schemes.xhtml):
- http
- https
- ssh
- vnc

The following unregistered URI schemes should also be strongly considered, with respect to [RFC7595](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7595):
- rdp
- ica
- tel (for telnet)
- raw
- rlog (for RLogin)

comments.author: jotatsu
comments.snippet: Proposed for 2.0, this is integrated by O.S uri association types and a better scriptable external interface for creating connetions.
